The diagram depicts DHCP between clients and servers in various locations.

Network Topology:
Three routers, ISP1, ISP2, and ISP3, are on the edge of the Internet cloud. In the cloud is an ISP DHCP server. Router ISP1 is labeled "Router DHCP Server". Three customers are connected. Each one is connected to one of the ISP's. Each ISP uses a different DCHP server.

Customer 1: Single home PC client connected to the ISP1 router. The home PC client gets its IP configuration from the ISP1 router, which is acting as a DHCP server.

Customer 2: Corporate network with several PC's connected to two switches. A local DHCP server is connected to one switch. The switches are connected together. A corporate router is connected to the other switch and is also connected to the ISP2 router. The corporate PC clients get their IP configuration from the local DHCP server.

Customer 3: Home, small business network with DHCP clients connected to the ISP3 router. These DHCP clients get their IP configurations from the ISP3 DHCP server, which is a standalone computer.
